channel.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
channel.description: Hi guys, I have a wierd moustache glitch on my server. When I type "::char" to change my appearance, I made my guy have no moustache or beard. When I pressed "Accept", I see this false glitchy moustache on my character. Can anyone tell me how to get rid of this error? Help please...[br][size=1]Posted on: May 08, 2007, 01:50:16 AM[/size][hr]Does anyone else have this error?

item.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

I have no errors when compiling when I finished the tutorial up ^, but I still get that glitchy moustache and beard look…

Read full topic

item.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
item.dc:creator: @I_Metal_I I Metal I
item.description:
@I_Metal_I wrote:

[quote author=gunztheduel link=topic=132983.msg1293310#msg1293310 date=1178788278]

[quote=“I Metal I, post:23, topic:91221”]Purpose: To get rid of that nasty whole in your face

Difficulty: 1 depends on what you know

Assumed Knowledge: c&p

Server Base: Pimp should work on all

Classes Modified: player.java

Procedure

Step 1: open up your player java and search for

playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]);

you should see

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

Step 2: scroll down slowly and look for

		// array of 5 bytes defining the colors

Step 3: If there is anything between that and

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {replace it with

[code] if (!Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1))
playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); // Beard
else
playerProps.writeByte(0);
} else {
playerProps.writeWord(-1);
playerProps.writeWord(npcId);

	}[/code]if there is nothing between them just put it under

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

I did your tutorial, I have no errors whe compiling, but I still have the glitch.[/quote]

Try editing some of the numbers in it… it works just fine for me and everyone else who has done it

Read full topic

item.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
item.dc:creator: @gunztheduel gunztheduel
item.description:
@gunztheduel wrote:

[quote author=I Metal I link=topic=132983.msg1289849#msg1289849 date=1178737029]
Purpose: To get rid of that nasty whole in your face

Difficulty: 1 depends on what you know

Assumed Knowledge: c&p

Server Base: Pimp should work on all

Classes Modified: player.java

Procedure

Step 1: open up your player java and search for

playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]);

you should see

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

Step 2: scroll down slowly and look for

		// array of 5 bytes defining the colors

Step 3: If there is anything between that and

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {replace it with

[code] if (!Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1))
playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); // Beard
else
playerProps.writeByte(0);
} else {
playerProps.writeWord(-1);
playerProps.writeWord(npcId);

	}[/code]if there is nothing between them just put it under

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

I did your tutorial, I have no errors whe compiling, but I still have the glitch.

Read full topic

item.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
item.dc:creator: @I_Metal_I I Metal I
item.description:
@I_Metal_I wrote:

Purpose: To get rid of that nasty whole in your face

Difficulty: 1 depends on what you know

Assumed Knowledge: c&p

Server Base: Pimp should work on all

Classes Modified: player.java

Procedure

Step 1: open up your player java and search for

playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]);

you should see

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

Step 2: scroll down slowly and look for

		// array of 5 bytes defining the colors

Step 3: If there is anything between that and

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {replace it with

[code] if (!Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1))
playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard); // Beard
else
playerProps.writeByte(0);
} else {
playerProps.writeWord(-1);
playerProps.writeWord(npcId);

	}[/code]if there is nothing between them just put it under

if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) { playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]); } else {

is posted at this site

MoparScape Help Tut List

if this dosent work (witch it should because it has on ALL servers before including test p16 cheeze and more then idk your just not doing it right…)

item.title: Character Face Glitch! In your face!
item.dc:creator: @xx_nub_xx xx nub xx
item.description:
@xx_nub_xx wrote:

open player.java and search for this

			if (playerEquipment[playerFeet] > 1) {
				playerProps.writeWord(0x200 + playerEquipment[playerFeet]);
			} else {
				playerProps.writeWord(0x100+pFeet);
			}

under that add this

			if (!Item.isFullHelm(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && !Item.isFullMask(playerEquipment[playerHat]) && (playerLook[0] != 1))
         playerProps.writeWord(0x100 + pBeard);      // Beard
            else
			playerProps.writeByte(0);
		} else {
			playerProps.writeWord(-1);
			playerProps.writeWord(npcId);

		}

Read full topic
